intro: Anthurium sarmentosum var. brachypodum, commonly known as the short-stemmed anthurium, is a member of the Araceae family. It is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves that are typically heart-shaped with a prominent midrib. The plant produces striking spadices, which are the modified leaves that enclose the small, inconspicuous flowers. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
